title: [Epidemiology] Interdependence and the cost of uncoordinated responses to COVID-19 - When just one-third of a state’s social and geographic peer states adopt shelter-in-place policies, it creates a reduction in mobility equal to the state’s own policy decisions, highlighting the need for national coordination
[Biology] A vaccine targeting the RBD of the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 induces protective immunity
